quoridorFE

Class QuoridorBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • quoridorFE.QuoridorBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class QuoridorBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The QuoridorBoard class implements the Quoridor board and the methods needed to interact with it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuoridorBoard

        public QuoridorBoard(quoridorFE.Player player1,
                     quoridorFE.Player player2)
        Constructor for initializing a 2 player quoridor board. Note: Player objects passed to the constructor are assumed to be unique and class methods may not behave as expected if there are player objects with duplicate IDs on the board.
        Parameters:
        player1 - Player object representing player 1.
        player2 - Player object representing player 2.

      • QuoridorBoard

        public QuoridorBoard(quoridorFE.Player player1,
                     quoridorFE.Player player2,
                     quoridorFE.Player player3,
                     quoridorFE.Player player4)
        Constructor for initializing a 4 player quoridor board. Note: Player objects passed to the constructor are assumed to be unique and class methods may not behave as expected if there are player objects with duplicate IDs on the board.
        Parameters:
        player1 - Player object representing player 1.
        player2 - Player object representing player 2.
        player3 - Player object representing player 3.
        player4 - Player object representing player 4.

        public quoridorFE.BoardNode getNodeByCoords(int x,
                                            int y)
        Retrieves the BoardNode that corresponds to the given position on the board.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the position on the board
        y - The y value of the position on the board
        Returns:
        BoardNode representing the given position on the board.
        See Also:
        BoardNode

      • getNodeByPlayerNumber

        public quoridorFE.BoardNode getNodeByPlayerNumber(int player)
        Retrieves the BoardNode corresponding to the space that the given player is occupying.
        Parameters:
        player - Number of the player whos location you're looking for.
        Returns:
        BoardNode representing the location of the given player.

      • getWallSet

        public java.util.HashSet<quoridorFE.Wall> getWallSet()
        Allows access to the set of walls that have been placed so far.
        Returns:
        A HashSet containing all the walls that have been placed on the board.
        See Also:
        Wall

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int player,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        Checks to see if the proposed pawn move is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        player - Number of the player attempting the move.
        x - The destination x position.
        y - The destination y position.
        Returns:
        False for an invalid move, True for a valid one.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int player,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           char orientation)
        Checks to see if the proposed wall placement is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        player - Number of the player attempting the move.
        x - The x position of the wall
        y - The y position of the wall
        orientation - The orientation of the wall.
        Returns:
        False for an invalid move, True for a valid one.

      • placeWall

                      int y,
                      char orientation)
        Place a wall on the board
        Parameters:
        player - Number of the player making the move.
        x - The x position of the wall
        y - The y position of the wall
        orientation - The orientation of the wall.
